canonical_explanation.text: A multiple of a number is obtained by multiplying it by 1, 2, 3, and so on. A factor of a number divides it exactly without leaving a remainder. Every number has at least two factors: 1 and itself.
rules: Multiples of a number go on forever: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, ...
The smallest multiple of any number is the number itself
A factor divides a number exactly (remainder = 0)
1 is a factor of every number
Every number is a factor of itself
To find all factors, check which numbers from 1 to the number divide it exactly

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a multiple of 6?
questions.explanation_correct: 42 = 6 x 7, so 42 is a multiple of 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A multiple of 6 is exactly divisible by 6. 42 / 6 = 7 (no remainder). The others leave remainders. Option B.

questions.question_text: The first five multiples of 4 are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply 4 by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which number is NOT a multiple of 5?
questions.explanation_correct: 53 is not a multiple of 5. Multiples of 5 end in 0 or 5. 53 ends in 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiples of 5 end in 0 or 5. 53 ends in 3, so it is not a multiple of 5. Option C.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a factor of 24?
questions.explanation_correct: 24 / 8 = 3 (no remainder), so 8 is a factor of 24.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check: 24/5 has remainder, 24/7 has remainder, 24/8=3 exactly, 24/9 has remainder. So 8 is a factor. Option C.

questions.question_text: How many factors does 12 have?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. That is 6 factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Factors of 12 are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Count = 6. Option C.

questions.question_text: What are all the factors of 18?
Every number is a multiple of 1. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. Any number times 1 gives that number, so every number is a multiple of 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. n = 1 x n, so every number is a multiple of 1.

questions.question_text: 1 is a factor of every number. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. Every number divided by 1 gives the number itself with no remainder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: True. n / 1 = n with remainder 0, so 1 is a factor of every number.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a common multiple of 3 and 4?
questions.explanation_correct: 12 is divisible by both 3 (12/3=4) and 4 (12/4=3), so it is a common multiple.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 12 = 3x4 = 4x3. It is a multiple of both 3 and 4. Option C.

questions.question_text: What are the common factors of 12 and 18?
questions.explanation_incorrect: List factors of each and find common ones. 12: {1,2,3,4,6,12}. 18: {1,2,3,6,9,18}. Common: {1,2,3,6}. Option A.

questions.question_text: How many factors does 36 have?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 36: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 36. That is 9 factors.

questions.question_text: Anita skip-counts by 7s. Which number will she NOT say?
questions.explanation_correct: Skip counting by 7: 7, 14, 21, 28, 35, 42, 49, ... 45 is not in this list because 45/7 has a remainder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiples of 7: 7, 14, 21, 28, 35, 42, 49. 45 is not a multiple of 7. Option C.

questions.question_text: Is 7 a factor of 56?

options.text: No, because 7 is odd and 56 is even

questions.explanation_correct: 56 / 7 = 8 (exactly, no remainder). So 7 is a factor of 56.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 56 / 7 = 8 with no remainder, so 7 is a factor of 56. Option A.

questions.question_text: What are all the factors of 20?
The common factors of 8 and 12 are:
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 8: 1, 2, 4, 8. Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Common: 1, 2, 4.

questions.question_text: The 8th multiple of 9 is:
questions.explanation_correct: 8th multiple of 9 = 9 x 8 = 72.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 x 8 = 72. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which number has exactly 2 factors?
questions.explanation_correct: 7 has only 2 factors: 1 and 7. Numbers with exactly 2 factors are called prime numbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 has factors 1,2,4 (3 factors). 7 has factors 1,7 (2 factors). 9 has 1,3,9. 12 has many. Option B.

questions.question_text: All factors of 30 are:
The greatest common factor of 16 and 24 is:
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 16: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. Factors of 24: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. Common: 1, 2, 4, 8. Greatest = 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Common factors of 16 and 24: 1, 2, 4, 8. The greatest is 8. Option A.

questions.question_text: A bell rings every 8 minutes. If it rang at 10:00, when will it ring again?
questions.explanation_correct: Every 8 minutes means the next ring is at 10:00 + 8 minutes = 10:08.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 10:00 + 8 minutes = 10:08. Option A.

questions.question_text: ___ is a factor of every number.
questions.explanation_correct: 1 is a factor of every number because every number divided by 1 gives the number itself.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1 divides every number exactly. So 1 is a factor of every number. Option B.

questions.question_text: How many multiples of 8 are there between 1 and 50?
questions.explanation_correct: Multiples of 8 up to 50: 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48. That is 6 multiples.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48 (the next would be 56, which is beyond 50). Count = 6. Option A.

questions.question_text: All factors of 15 are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: 15 is not divisible by 2 or 4. Factors: 1, 3, 5, 15. Option A.

questions.question_text: Common factors of 20 and 30 are:
The smallest multiple of any number is:
questions.explanation_correct: The smallest positive multiple of any number is the number itself (number x 1).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Any number x 1 = the number itself. This is its smallest positive multiple. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which number is a factor of both 27 and 36?
questions.explanation_correct: 27 / 9 = 3 and 36 / 9 = 4. Both divide exactly, so 9 is a common factor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 27/9=3 (exact) and 36/9=4 (exact). So 9 is a factor of both. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which number has the most factors: 10, 12, or 16?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 10: 1,2,5,10 (4). Factors of 12: 1,2,3,4,6,12 (6). Factors of 16: 1,2,4,8,16 (5). 12 has the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 10 has 4 factors, 12 has 6 factors, 16 has 5 factors. 12 has the most. Option A.

questions.question_text: Is 42 a multiple of 7?
questions.explanation_correct: 42 / 7 = 6 (exactly). So 42 is a multiple of 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 42 = 7 x 6, so yes, 42 is a multiple of 7.

questions.question_text: The greatest common factor of 24 and 36 is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Common factors: 1,2,3,4,6,12. Greatest = 12. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a factor of 48?
questions.explanation_correct: 48 / 9 = 5 remainder 3. So 9 is not a factor of 48.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 48/6=8 (factor), 48/8=6 (factor), 48/16=3 (factor), 48/9=5r3 (not a factor). Option A.

questions.question_text: Which is the smallest common multiple of 6 and 8?
questions.explanation_correct: Multiples of 6: 6, 12, 18, 24, ... Multiples of 8: 8, 16, 24, ... First common multiple is 24.
questions.explanation_incorrect: List multiples until you find a common one. 6: 6,12,18,24. 8: 8,16,24. First common = 24. Option A.

questions.question_text: Factors of 25 are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: 25 is not divisible by 2, 3, or 4. Factors: 1, 5, 25. Option A.

questions.question_text: Ravi plants flowers in rows of 6. Which of these CANNOT be the total number of flowers?
questions.explanation_correct: 50 is not a multiple of 6 (50/6 = 8 remainder 2). The others are multiples of 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 30=6x5, 42=6x7, 54=6x9 (all multiples of 6). 50/6 has remainder 2. Option C.

questions.question_text: Every number is a factor of itself. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. Any number divided by itself equals 1 with no remainder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: n / n = 1 (remainder 0). So every number is a factor of itself. True.

questions.question_text: Which pair of numbers has only 1 as a common factor?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 8: 1,2,4,8. Factors of 15: 1,3,5,15. Only common factor is 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8: {1,2,4,8}. 15: {1,3,5,15}. No common factors except 1. Option A.

questions.question_text: How many factors does 100 have?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 100: 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 20, 25, 50, 100. That is 9 factors.

questions.question_text: The 6th multiple of 7 is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: 6th multiple of 7 = 7 x 6 = 42.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 x 6 = 42. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which number has exactly 3 factors?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 4: 1, 2, 4. That is exactly 3 factors. (Numbers with exactly 3 factors are perfect squares of primes.)

questions.question_text: Common factors of 15 and 25 are:
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 15: 1, 3, 5, 15. Factors of 25: 1, 5, 25. Common: 1, 5.

questions.question_text: The 10th multiple of 9 is:
questions.explanation_correct: 10th multiple of 9 = 9 x 10 = 90.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 x 10 = 90. Option A.

questions.question_text: All factors of 8 are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Factors of 8: 1, 2, 4, 8. Option A.

questions.question_text: Ritu has 32 beads and wants to make necklaces with equal numbers of beads. She can make necklaces with how many beads each? (Choose one that works)
questions.explanation_correct: 32 / 8 = 4 (exactly). So she can make 4 necklaces with 8 beads each. 8 is a factor of 32.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 32/8=4 (no remainder). 32/5, 32/6, 32/7 all have remainders. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which of these numbers is a multiple of both 3 and 5?
questions.explanation_correct: 15/3=5 and 15/5=3. 15 is a multiple of both 3 and 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 15 = 3x5, so it is a multiple of both 3 and 5. Option A.

questions.question_text: The greatest common factor of 18 and 24 is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Common factors of 18 and 24: 1,2,3,6. Greatest = 6. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which number has the fewest factors: 16, 17, or 18?
questions.explanation_incorrect: 17 is prime (only 2 factors: 1 and 17). 16 has 5 and 18 has 6. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a multiple of 9?
questions.explanation_correct: 46 / 9 = 5 remainder 1. So 46 is not a multiple of 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 27=9x3, 36=9x4, 63=9x7 (all multiples). 46/9 has remainder. Option C.

questions.question_text: Is 3 a factor of 45?
questions.explanation_correct: 45 / 3 = 15 (exactly). So 3 is a factor of 45.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 45 / 3 = 15, no remainder. So 3 is a factor of 45. Option A.

questions.question_text: Common factors of 10 and 25 are:
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 10: 1,2,5,10. Factors of 25: 1,5,25. Common: 1,5.

questions.question_text: The number of factors of 50 is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 50: 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50. Count = 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 50: 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50. That is 6 factors. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which is a common multiple of 4, 6, and 12?
questions.explanation_correct: 12/4=3, 12/6=2, 12/12=1. 12 is divisible by all three, so it is a common multiple.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 12 is a multiple of 4 (4x3), 6 (6x2), and 12 (12x1). Option A.
